subject: Leadership
title: Ethical Legacy
description: A micro-lesson that makes Ethical Legacy usable.

hook.text: When you leave your role, what remains? The deals fade. The revenue resets. But the culture you built persists.

buildup.text: Collins' Level 5 leaders build organizations that thrive after departure. Personal glory isn't the goal. Legacy is.

discovery.text: Ethical legacy means policies, values, and norms so embedded that they outlast any individual leader's tenure.

twist.text: Charismatic leaders who centralize ethics in themselves create fragile cultures. When they leave, the ethics leave too.

climax.text: Codify values in systems. Develop ethical leaders at every level. Build the culture into the DNA, not the personality.

punchline.text: The truest measure of ethical leadership: does the ethics survive you?

quiz.question: Why is centralizing ethics in one leader dangerous?
options: When the leader leaves, the ethical culture can collapse
